Starting Monday, July 28th, our Naples pool will close 3:00 PM - 6:00 PM, Monday - Friday, for high school swim & dive team practices.
Click here
to check the updated pool schedule.
The Y. For a better us.
Driven by its founding mission, the Y has served as a leading non-profit committed to strengthening community.
Why the Y?
Guided by our core values of Caring, Honesty, Respect, Responsibility, and Faith, we empower everyone by ensuring access to critical programs, services, and relationships. For more than 50 years, we’ve remained dedicated to helping Collier County learn, grow, and thrive.
Working Side-by-Side with Our Community
Expand all
Collapse all
+ Our Mission
Our Mission
To put Judeo Christian principles into practice through programs that build healthy spirit, mind and body for all.
Our mission helps us to improve the lives of all in Collier County by connecting individuals, families, and communities with opportunities that strengthen spirit, mind, and body.
+ Our Purpose
Our Purpose
The Y is the leading non-profit committed to strengthening the community by connecting children, teens, adults, and seniors to their potential, purpose, and each other.
+ Who We Are
Who We Are
Every community needs a leader to bring people together, compel others to action, and empower every individual to be their best so the community can grow stronger together. We’re more than a gym; the YMCA of Collier County is a non-profit organization that’s been serving Collier County since 1967. We’re a coalition of members committed to the idea that our community can be better tomorrow than it is today.
+ What We Do
What We Do
We have presence and partnerships to deliver positive change across Collier County. Every day, we work to make sure that everyone—regardless of age, income, or background—has access to life-changing opportunities. The Y helps today’s youth develop into well-educated adults, empower individuals of all ages to live healthier lives, and inspire people to give back and support those in need.
+ Why it Matters
Why it Matters
Our impact is felt daily in our neighborhoods, and our obligation to the community is continuously growing. Together with our advocates, we’ll continue to innovate, embrace new partners, and be a force for transforming communities in Collier County.
accordion
Areas of Impact
Expand all
Collapse all
+ Youth Development
Swim, Sports, and Camps
The Y offers swim, sports, and recreational programs designed for the youth. These programs are beneficial in forming healthy exercise habits early on, while also being a fun outlet for kids to let out their energy. Kids will build their confidence, sportsmanship, and learn the importance of teamwork.
Our Ys also offer all kinds of camp programs from specialty to day to ensure you’ll find one that’s right for your family! Kids will have the opportunity to explore nature, find new talents, try exciting activities, gain independence, and create lasting bonds and memories.
Child Development
Kids absorb the knowledge, skills, and value around them from a young age, which is why our Early Learning Centers are filled with staff who understand their development. Our programs allow kids to grow their values and skills, build their confidence and receive support from role models engaged in their future.
+ Healthy Living
Health, Wellbeing, and Fitness
The Y understands the importance of nurturing the spirit, mind, and body. For this reason, our health and wellness programs are more than physical fitness. In addition to fitness facilities, we provide educational programs to promote healthier decisions and offer a variety of programs that support physical, intellectual, and spiritual strength.
Sports and Recreation
The Y offers sports team programs that meet all needs. Whether you’re looking for a recreational sport to play during your free time, or a more structured team to meet your competitive goals, the Y offers a program for all adult and youth members.
+ Social Responsibility
Volunteerism and Giving
More than 50 years ago, the Y was founded by a group of individuals who wanted to improve our community. Today, Y volunteers and our supporters remain at the heart of our organization. It’s only through the support of our volunteers and both public and private donors that we’re able to serve more people and deliver on our cause to strengthen the community.
Financial Assistance
Thanks to the generosity of our donors, the Y is able to offer scholarships to individuals and families for YMCA membership and programs. Scholarship amounts are granted based on the applicant’s demonstrated need due to household income and/or extenuating circumstances and the availability of scholarship funds.
To apply for financial assistance, please contact Member Services.
accordion
Our History
Expand all
Collapse all
+ North Campus (Naples YMCA)
The North Campus is in the heart of Naples. In 1967 with a strong belief in the Young Mens Christian Association movement, Ms. Gladys Donohue and Mr. Joseph Ruffing, Jr. filed the first documents to create the Collier County YMCA. From humble beginnings, made by an association who saw the hopefulness of a plot of land on the corner of Airport Road and Pine Ridge Road, the Y has committed itself to strengthening our community. Fifty-three years later, thousands of volunteers and staff members have worked tirelessly to address social needs and change lives.
Location
5450 YMCA Road
Naples, FL 34109
Telephone:
239-394-9622
Email:
info@ymcacollier.org
Branch Hours:
Monday - Thursday: 5:30 am - 9:00 pm
Fri: 5:30 am - 8:00 pm
Sat: 6:00 am - 4:00 pm
Sun: 7:30 am - 4:00 pm
Amenities available at Naples
Wellness Center with state-of-the-art equipment
Outdoor swimming pool
Tennis center, lighted for outdoor play
Early Learning Center
Group Exercise & Cycling Studios
Gymnasium with Full-Size Court and Pickleball hours
Community Kitchen
Community Meeting Spaces
Outdoor Ability Field
Cafe with Day and Evening Hours
Community Events
+ South Campus (Marco Island YMCA)
For 40 years, the South Campus has been committed to helping children, families and communities reach their full potential.  The Marco Y was founded on November 14, 1977 when the current location was donated by Deltona as a branch of the Collier County YMCA. Today, the Marco Y is an independent nonprofit organization whose mission is to put Judeo-Christian principles into practice through programs that build healthy spirit, mind and body for all. At the Y, we are committed to helping all people get access to the resources and support to thrive.
Location
101 Sand Hill Street
Marco Island, FL 34145
Telephone:
239-394-9622
Email:
info@
ymcacol
lier.org
Branch Hours:
Monday - Thursday: 6:00 am - 9:00 pm
Fri: 6:00 am - 8:00 pm
Sat: 7:00 am - 4:00 pm
Sun: 7:00 am - 4:00 pm
Amenities available at Marco Island
Wellness Center with state-of-the-art equipment
Outdoor swimming pool
Tennis center, lighted for evening play
Outdoor Pickleball Courts (9)
Early Learning Center
Youth & Teen Center
Group Exercise & Cycling Studios
Gymnasium with Full-Size Court
24-hour Fitness Center
Outdoor Airnasium
Community Garden
Community Events

Y MEMBERSHIP IS GOOD FOR BUSINESS
Healthy, happy people are good employees. Working parents need quality, safe child care they feel good about. A well-rounded benefits package, one that includes a YMCA of Collier County membership, is attractive to current and potential employees.
An estimated 25-30% of companies’ medical costs per year were spent on employees with excess, often preventable, health risks. Other benefits that companies see include:
Reduced Healthcare Costs:
The majority of US health care expenses can be attributed to the diagnosis and treatment of chronic diseases and health conditions such as diabetes, obesity, cardiovascular disease and high blood pressure. Positive lifestyle changes, such as increased physical activity and a healthy diet, can often prevent these costly medical conditions before they arise.
Increased Productivity and Morale:
Workers who exercise regularly tend to have more energy and be more productive while at work. As little as 30 minutes of physical activity several days a week can have a significant positive impact on workers’ physical and mental well-being.
Decreased Turnover and Increased Recruitment Potential:
Many employees view health promotion programs as an added perk that makes them feel valued and appreciated by their employer. Employees who feel valued are less likely to seek employment elsewhere, decreasing turnover and the time and money needed to recruit, hire and train new workers. Similarly, a well-being program can serve as a valuable recruiting tool as you seek to attract the best possible talent to your organization.
Decreased Absenteeism:
Employees suffering from a chronic health condition are more likely to miss work than healthy employees. Helping workers make positive lifestyle changes can reduce absenteeism and the drain it represents on company morale and resources.
DOWNLOAD BROCHURE
Expand all
Collapse all
+ Why a corporate membership with the Y?
Through a YMCA corporate membership, your workforce has access to a full complement of resources for increased physical activity and improved overall health.
Member Benefits Includes:
Two YMCA locations (Marco and Naples)
State-of-the-art fitness center with cardio and free weights.
Group and Water Exercise Classes
, including Pilates, Zumba, BODYPUMP, Yoga, Spin and more!
Child care for up to two hours in our
Kids’ Zone
FREE Wellness Orientation
Family-Focused Activities
Savings on Programs
A community of friends and support!
+ Corporate membership package options
Corporate Wellness employees can receive up to a 10% discount on monthly membership fees and pay $0 join fee. Membership teams at each Y location can verify participating Corporate Wellness partners and answer any questions about joining the Y.
Here is the breakdown of our corporate membership rates.
# Employees*
Discount
Joiner's Fee
5 - 10 Employees
5%
$0
11 - 25 Employees
10%
$0
26+ Employees
15%
$0
*required units on corporate account to receive discount.
+ How to get started
START TODAY!
Membership at the Y means your employees will get the support they need to achieve their health goals. Benefits coordinators or designated Human Resources representatives are encouraged to contact the YMCA to set-up a corporate membership program for your company.
Employees of existing corporate partners should bring in proof of employment (recent pay stub or dated paperwork proving employment) to the YMCA to join as part of a corporate group.
To begin, email us at
membership@ymcacollier.org
.
accordion
QUESTIONS?
To begin your corporate membership partnership or for more information, email us at
membership@ymcacollier.org
.

Pool Schedule - High School Swim Teams
Starting Monday, July 28th, our Naples pool will close 3:00 PM - 6:00 PM, Monday - Friday, for high school swim & dive team practices.
Click here
to check the updated pool schedule.
Swim Team & Clinics
Discover our swim team programs for youth aged 6-17, featuring competition, coaching, and fun! YMCA swim team offers year-round instruction for all ages and abilities, emphasizing sportsmanship, teamwork, and individual development.
Swim team levels based on their age and ability, see our options below:
Expand all
Collapse all
+ Novice Swim Team Program
Becoming a member of the YMCA Swim Team means fun, fitness and teamwork.
This developmental swim program offers children and teens an opportunity to work with trained coaches to improve swimmers' competitive skills, endurance and promote a healthy lifestyle, through progression rather than intense competition.
Training Duration:
45 or 60 minutes
Location:
North Campus, South Campus
Registering is easy!
Determine the location and weekday/weekend session you'd like below, and click Register to complete your enrollment.
BROWSE PROGRAMS
+ Competitive Swim Team Program
Our YMCA Competitive Swim Team program offers a fun and challenging environment for swimmers who can already demonstrate basic skills and are ready to take those skills to the next level!
Emphasis is placed on developing the four competitive strokes, techniques, racing skills, and endurance, while focusing on teamwork, sportsmanship and healthy competition. Our coaches encourage swimmers every step of the way to improve and do their personal best while training together as a team. Being on the swim team is a great way to meet new friends, work out and have fun - all at the same time!
Training Duration:
60 minutes
Location:
North Campus, South Campus
Registering is easy!
Determine the location and weekday/weekend session you'd like below, and click Register to complete your enrollment.
BROWSE PROGRAMS
+ Swim Team Clinics
Come join our new program for swimmers who are looking to get stroke specific work from our highly qualified coaches. Stroke clinics will be 45 minute clinics where swimmers will develop their skills and get work on becoming better swimmers. Swim clinics are children ages 6+.
Training Duration:
45 or 60 minutes
Location:
North Campus, South Campus
Registering is easy!
Determine the location and session you'd like below, and click Register to complete your enrollment.
BROWSE CLINICS
+ Private Swim Training
The Y offers advanced swimming lessons to competitive swimmers for athletes looking to improve their stroke. Sessions will be designed according to swimmers abilities and goals, allowing for targeted skill refinement and maximum progression.
Training Packages
Y Member
Non-Member
1 Session (45 Minutes)
$50
$65
4 Session (45 Minutes Ea.)
$185
$245
8 Session (45 Minutes Ea.)
$350
$450
Registering is easy!
Determine the location and session you'd like below, and click Register to complete your enrollment.
BROWSE PROGRAMS

OUR TEAM
It takes a successful group of people to make all the great things happening at the Y possible. Every one of our staff members and trainers work together to make sure that every community member has the chance to thrive and succeed.
Each of us shares our time, energy and focus on strengthening our communities through helping kids reach their potential, encouraging healthy living for all ages, and giving back to our neighbors. We welcome you to stop by and say hello.

We’d love to hear from you!
The YMCA of Collier County is a nonprofit organization committed to enhancing lives in spirit, mind, and body and fostering stronger communities through its dedication to Youth Development, Healthy Living, and Social Responsibility. With a focus on these pillars, we provide services to tens of thousands of individuals through our YMCA family centers.
If you have any questions about membership, programs, or community involvement, please fill out the Contact Form. A member of the YMCA of Collier County staff will promptly respond to your inquiry.

Membership Agreement & Liability
Review our Membership Agreement to learn more about the terms and conditions.
VIEW AGREEMENT
Membership Policies
Identification Requirements
The Y is committed to providing a safe environment for everyone. To ensure this, we require a government-issued ID for all individuals aged 18 and older entering our facilities. This ID is used for conducting a sex offender background check, and verifying identity when necessary. This applies to all individuals, including members, guests, spectators, and visitors. Please note that all personal information collected is confidential and will not be shared, except as required by law or for safety purposes.
Year-round and Monthly (Seasonal) Memberships
Memberships are non-refundable and non-transferable. Year-round memberships must be renewed within 90 days of expiring/deactivation to avoid paying a Join Fee.
Join Fee
Join Fees are non-refundable. If a membership has lapsed for more than 90 days from the last draft, the full Join Fee must be paid upon return.
Continuous Monthly Membership Dues
Dues are continuous every month until the proper change procedure is followed.
If for any reason your check or electronic draft is returned, it may be collected electronically through a third party vendor. A minimum return fee of $30 will be assessed for this service.
The YMCA is not responsible for any other collection fees assessed by individual banking institutions.
Members whose electronic draft is returned and not resolved prior to the next draft date will have their membership canceled by the YMCA. In order to reinstate a membership, all outstanding balances must be paid in full.
Credit Card Service Fee
A service fee of three percent (3%) will be applied to all credit card transactions and payments processed using a credit card. This fee helps offset the cost of credit card processing and is non-refundable. Members may avoid this fee by choosing to pay via electronic funds transfer (EFT) or other accepted payment methods that do not incur the service fee.
Membership Cancellation
To cancel your membership, please provide a 30-day written notice.
This can be done online through our
Membership Change Web Form
or in person at our facility. Please note that verbal or phone cancellations are not accepted.
REQUEST CANCELLATION
There are third-party companies that falsely claim they can manage changes to your Y membership for a fee. These companies are not affiliated with the Y and often mislead individuals for profit. You never have to pay to change or cancel your membership. If you have questions, please contact us.
Membership Holds
Members may place their membership on hold for up to 3 months per year. This can be done online through our Membership Change Web Form or in person at our facility. Your membership will automatically resume after the hold expires. Please note that the YMCA will not send a reminder prior to reinstatement.
If you wish to cancel your membership during the hold period, please notify the YMCA before your reinstatement date. No refunds will be issued for drafts processed after reinstatement.
REQUEST HOLD
member code of conduct
The YMCA is committed to providing a safe and welcoming environment for all members and guests. To promote safety and comfort for all, all individuals are asked to act appropriately at all times when in our facility or participating in our programs. We expect persons using the YMCA to act maturely, to behave responsibly, and to respect the rights and dignity of others. Our Member’s Code of Conduct outlines prohibited behavior, but the actions listed below are not an all-inclusive list of behaviors considered inappropriate in our facilities or programs:
Using or possessing alcohol or illegal chemicals on YMCA property
YMCA facilities and grounds are smoke-free environments.
Carrying or concealing a weapon or any device or object that may be used as a weapon
Use of cell phones in the YMCA’s shower and locker room areas
Use of any video/picture taking equipment, including camera phones, in YMCA’s shower rooms, locker rooms, and fitness center area
Harassment or intimidation by words, gestures, body language, or any type of menacing behavior
Physical contact with another person in an angry, aggressive or threatening way
Verbally abusive behavior, including angry or vulgar language, swearing, name-calling, or shouting
Sexually explicit conversation or behavior: any sexual contact with another person
Inappropriate, immodest, or sexually revealing attire
Theft or behavior that results in the destruction or loss of property
Loitering within or on the grounds of the YMCA
In addition, the YMCA reserves the right to deny access or membership to any person who has been accused or convicted of any crime involving sexual abuse, is or has been a registered sex offender, has ever been convicted of any offense relating to the use, sale, possession, or transportation of narcotics or habit forming and/or dangerous drugs, or is presently or habitually under the influence of dangerous drugs or chemicals, narcotics, or intoxicating beverages.
If a member or guest feels uncomfortable, they should report the behavior to a staff immediately. In order to carry out these policies, we ask that members and guests identify themselves when asked. The YMCA will investigate all reported incidents. Suspension or termination of YMCA membership privileges may result if, in his or her discretion, a violation of the Code Conduct has occurred.
Cell Phones & Other Electronics
YMCA Locker Room Cell Phone Policy
The use of cell phones will not be permitted in the YMCA locker rooms and changing areas. We ask that you put all electronics and cameras away while in changing areas.
YMCA Cell Phone and Equipment Policy
To ensure all members have a positive and productive workout experience, we ask that you be considerate of others while using gym equipment. Please be mindful of how your cell phone use impacts the availability of machines for other members.
Key Policies:
Be Mindful of Others:
If you need to make a call or send a text, please step away from the equipment. This allows other members to use the machine while you are occupied.
Time Limits:
Please respect the posted time limits on cardio machines and other popular equipment. Extended use for personal calls or social media is a form of delaying the use of the equipment, and it's unfair to other members.
Safety First:
Be aware of your surroundings and the people around you. Distracted cell phone use can pose a safety risk to yourself and others, especially in areas with free weights or complex machinery.
Headphones Recommended:
If you need to listen to music or take a call, please use headphones to avoid disturbing others.
Your cooperation helps us maintain a respectful and efficient workout environment for everyone.
fitness center AGE REQUIREMENTS
Ages 9 & under
are not permitted on the Fitness Floor.
Ages 10-12
may use the Fitness Center and actively participate in non-weight bearing (i.e. dumbbells, free-weights, bands, etc.) group exercise classes with direct parental supervision.
Ages 13 and up
may use the Fitness Center (fitness equipment, cardio and free-weights) and participate in group exercise classes without adult supervision.
Prohibited Commercial Activities
To ensure a safe, professional, and consistent experience for all members, the YMCA of Collier County has a strict policy against conducting business or soliciting services on our premises. This policy protects our members, our staff, and the integrity of our programs.
Members are not permitted to engage in any form of commercial activity within the YMCA facility or on its grounds. This includes, but is not limited to:
Selling products or services:
Offering goods, supplements, or merchandise for sale to other members or staff.
Providing paid instruction:
Conducting personal training, coaching, swim lessons, or any other type of instruction for a fee.
Soliciting business:
Distributing business cards, flyers, or other promotional materials, or actively seeking clients for a business unrelated to the YMCA.
This policy is in place to protect all members from a number of risks. The YMCA is responsible for the health and safety of individuals in our facilities. Only our professionally trained, certified, and insured staff are authorized to provide paid instruction. This ensures that all services meet our high standards for safety, expertise, and quality.
Any member found to be in violation of this policy will be subject to disciplinary action, which may include a warning, suspension of membership privileges, or termination of their membership.
QUESTIONS?
For more information, contact us at
membership@ymcacollier.org
.

YMCA BOARD OF DIRECTORS
YMCA of Collier County's Board of Directors brings a diverse set of skills and experience to support the Y's mission and work to strengthen communities. Their commitment and unique talents provides critical guidance to ensure our vision and strategy align with our mission. These dedicated individuals are critical to the success of the YMCA of the Collier County.

OUR BOARD HISTORY
Explore the rich history of the YMCA board and its influential past board presidents. Discover the visionaries who have steered this organization towards success.
VIEW GALLERY
BECOME A BOARD MEMBER
Help shape what the YMCA of Collier County is, and what it will be by volunteering as a board member! This is a great opportunity to make a difference in our community, meet others who are interested in helping, and to make sure the Greater Naples YMCA continues to be a place dedicated to empowering everyone in our community!
If you have an interest in exploring a board position with the YMCA or would like to recommend someone, please contact us.
